issue.title: FCD Ballot Comment CH-27
issue.discussion: The mutex requirements force try_lock to be noexcept(true). However, where they are used by the generic algorithms, those relax this requirement and say that try_lock may throw. This means the requirement is too stringent, also a non-throwing try_lock does not allow for a diagnostic such as system_error that lock() will give us.
issue.resolution: delete p18, adjust 30.4.4 p1 and p4 accordingly
